Reviews.Title: “Do not. I repeat. Do not stay here”
Reviews.Author: Macca0000
Reviews.Content: Do not. I repeat. Do not stay here. their websie is a house of lies. I really wish i had walked straight out. I was with a group of mates and we were only using it to sleep in but i'd rather have slept on the bench ove the road. From the staff not understanding a word of english to the blood on the walls in the bedroom. The rundown naure of the entire hotel has left me scared for life.The bedding was unclean. The bathroom was a disgrace and i wouldn't let my moral enemy stay here. I have just looked and hey are charging £245 a night during the Olypics. Daylight robbery. I have reported them to the authories because if this place has a health certificate then it's an absolute disgrace.

Reviews.Title: “Hideous hotel, ignorant staff, v low standard !!”
Reviews.Author: lillybob84
Reviews.Content: Stayed here on last min booking as my daughter had auditions, hotel looks ok from outside, then you get inside, woman on reception wouldn't harm her to crack a smile or speak English besides you pay now n leave ur keys... We stayed in 2 rooms 206 & 410, 206 room we searched for for 15 mins only to realise we had no dr number, 410 had half missing. Gets into room n slamming the dr as it wouldn't shut the windows didn't shut, tiles cracked big hole in sink where there should ave been a plug, mouldy shower curtain and black stained tiles in bath, ( needless to say we stayed clear ).. We left hotel for as long as we could at night n was up n out for 7 next morning didn't even dare touch breakfast. Went to go for drink in the bar which is not there, the hotel safe was in lobby on couple of 2x4s at side of couch, there was holes in the walls paint dried on carpets just not nice at all! Just glad I didn't have to sleep in a kitchen.. Only gd thing going for this hotel is its location.... Rotten place stay away very rude staff that hardly speak or understand English.. The night man left us in reception with till keys the lot all there while he ran after his boyfriend down street b4 he would give us our keys....

Reviews.Title: “ABSOLUTE CRAP - AVOID AT ALL COSTS”
Reviews.Author: Tell_it_like_it_is30
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a load of crap and I would avoid it at all costs. The previous review could not have possibly be done on this hotel as it contradicts every other review and seems exaggerated. . The room for a family of 4 was filthy, smelly, cramped with 3 beds pushed together. The shower glass recess was broken away from the hinges with pieces missing. We complained, and were given another room, which was just as bad. The bathroom sink did not even drain, the room was abundant with holes within the walls, the lights did not work, the door did not lock securely and there were damp patches on the ceiling. The entire hotel is a fire hazard, the hallways had rubbish everywhere, we had to drag our luggage around, no one certainly assisted my family with luggage in fact I was just stared at when struggling to enter the narrow entrance. The hotel was not secure and we were very concerned for our personal belongings. My family and I were so distressed by the condition of this place we checked out within 2 hours forgoing the 5 nights we had already prepaid. We were offered a "flat" as we checked out which we declined and checked in elsewhere which cost us an additional $AUD2000. The professional photos on the Internet are fake, a backpacker’s hostel would have been better. AVOID AT ALL COSTS - THERE IS NOTHING GOOD ABOUT THIS HOTEL- DO NOT BELIEVE THE EXAGGEATED REVIEWS EITHER.

Reviews.Title: “Splendid hotel”
Reviews.Author: Bard E Posted by a Finn traveler
Reviews.Content: As we walked into the glorious hallway, the staff ran onto us for helping with our baggage and carrying it to the room. Our room was big, fresh and newly washed and had a great view. The smell of soap was present and I think the floor carpet had recently been washed thoroughly. It was a great experience showering in the bathroom and all the bed clothes and curtains was of the newest fashion. The Tv worked well and the hotel provided us with some great coffee and a water boiler so we could enjoy our freshly made coffee in our tremendously splendid room We were too hungover to check out the breakfast though but according to rumours it was close to heaven. What can I say? I simply recommend this top-notch hotel to everyone who enjoys a litle bit of comfort. Board from Oslo.

Reviews.Title: “Probably THE WORST Hotel I have ever stayed in!”
Reviews.Author: BrianShaz
Reviews.Content: We had a quick stopover in Paddington and hsould have checked better, we had stayed in the area a few times at other hotels and we figured they would all be about the same. WRONG! Simply DO NOT STAY HERE, there are better ones just down Craven Rd for around the same price. As for breakfast, dont eat it go unless you want to be sick. Just have a look at the readers photos......

Reviews.Title: “Absolute Dump”
Reviews.Author: B_sMum
Reviews.Content: Do not book this hotel, the picures are a con. The carpets are dirty and threadbare the room are cramped and un-clean. first room i went in was up 5 flights of stairs no lift and had stained sheets !!!! Horrid

Reviews.Title: “Simply Awful”
Reviews.Author: Jen150663
Reviews.Content: I cannot express how disappointing it was to walk into this hotel. Shoddy is an understatement. The threadbare carpets as you entered the narrow reception area should've been a war ning sign (it reminded me of a run-down taxi waiting room). The twin room was cramped. The curtains didn't open. The beds were cheap and very uncomfortable. The bedspreads were at least a foot too short for the beds. The bathroom was tiny and very grim. The basin had a broken tap, the toilet flush was almost hanging off. There were coffee sachets with cups but no kettle. The drawers were all broken and sat upon each other. I didn't want to unpack my stuff - it was just miserable. The photographs on the internet do not reflect this hotel at all - where were these photos taken?? They don't resemble the hotel I stayed in!! Good location but I would NEVER recommend this hotel to anybody.

Reviews.Title: “Don't book this hotel”
Reviews.Author: mariaboye
Reviews.Content: The pictures online is not what you get. The 50% of pictures of the hotel on the page where I booked the hotel does not have anything to do with the hotel. I had booked a single room. I got a very small room with a very small frosted window (20 cm x 60 cm), no heat in the room, the carpet was wet and the TV was nowhere to be found.

Reviews.Title: “Don't get fooled”
Reviews.Author: Anonnamyous
Reviews.Content: What is advertised on line isn't what you are getting. It looks great from the outside but wait till you get in!! The pictures they advertise on line look nothing like what you really get. The elevator is old and you are lucky you can fit 2 people with luggage and the rooms are old a and bathtub had tape on it...broken. Not worth the money they charge...a hostile is much better.

Reviews.Title: “Basic but clean”
Reviews.Author: Goldie80 Posted by an OctopusTravel traveler
Reviews.Content: We planned our trip to London for NYE 2010, we had only had a small budget and just wanted a clean room to put down our heads at the end of the night as we weren't planning on staying in and The Ascot matched this expectation. It is very basic and in desperate need of a refurb but we found the staff were very helpful & friendly, if your looking for nice decor and comfortable rooms this probably isn't for you.

Reviews.Title: “Horrendous!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Lionheart22
Reviews.Content: I'm not normally one to complain but........the hotel is nothing like the website, we had booked a family room and were given a tiny room that had a double and a single squashed together in it, no way of getting in or out of the double bed. it also had a KITCHEN UNIT in the room which took up all the spare space! Breakfast was something else, basically a room in the cellar that had a toaster, a covered pool table and a few tables and chairs, you were expected to make your own toast, and given the lavish choices of hard boiled egg or plastic cheese to put on it. There were no plates, or cutlery available so we had to search for those and there was a cue. There were a lot of foreign visitors in the hotel and I would have been ashamed to be English had it not been for the the fact that the owners were not English and none of the staff spoke English. I could go on but you get the idea..........AVOID IT AT ALL COSTS Wish I'd looked at Trip Advisor before booking!

Reviews.Title: “Cheap and perfect position!”
Reviews.Author: ragonair
Reviews.Content: It's a very small hotel at 2 min walking from Paddington subway station that is the start stop to Heatrow Airport. Room is small, bed are not so confortable but the bath is in there and the price is cheap to be London! So close to the subway. If u dont care about the inside location and just think about a base. Its your hotel. Reception people arent kind and they want u to pay when arrive!

Reviews.Title: “I'd rather spend the night on a park bench!!”
Reviews.Author: G-Ellwood
Reviews.Content: On my way home from a night at this hotel and boy did I enjoy checking out. Where to start....... I'll keep it brief. This hotel is a hole. Our room was like an extension to the London Dungeon tour, damp, smelly and filthy. The torn carpet was last hoovered during the 80's, the ceiling covered in damp pathes and the walls not threatened with a paint brush this side of the millennium. Please do not waste your hard earned cash on a room here, spend a little more for a hotel that you dont have to sleep fully clothed for fear of catching something. It is that bad. I wouldn't even send my mother-in-law here!

Reviews.Title: “avoid it like plague”
Reviews.Author: travellingdoctor48
Reviews.Content: very shoddy. picture in the trip advisor must be very old - lift is a death trap, stairs are too narrow and winding, rooms are filthy. toilet is needing a clean. tiles were broken, tap does not work, kettle's bottom is peeling - needs a replacement. I had to wait 2 days to get a replacement - only when I insisted that i am not leaving the frontdesk without it. unfortunately we have made reservation on line so if we do not proceed with the stay we will be penalised 1 day stay which is not exactly cheap. beds are worn, i can feel the springs on my back, musty smelling too

Reviews.Title: “NEVER EVER AGAIN!!!”
Reviews.Author: Foxie95
Reviews.Content: Well, what can I say? I beg you, don't book here, please don't give these owners any money to keep this pit open! I can honestly say that although the purpose of our stay was pleasure (which included going to a show and a concert), the hotel really let our overall experience down. It was filthy, smelly, run down! Everything in our room was broken, there was barely enough room for me and my Husband to walk around the bed! We couldn't close the bathroom door - it was broke, the hairdryer broke!, tv - broke, window broke!, shower - broke! No wardrobe, no cups for tea, no milk ! But guess what there is a washing machine and cooker ! ??? Don't bother with breakfast - unless you like cold hard bolied eggs with a slab of cheese! and again no cups for tea or coffee either! The only good thing about the hotel was location but trust me this is not a good enough plus to ever want to stay here again! Oh and I should mention the stairs! make sure your fit enough to climb 7 flights of filthy, poorly fitted carpet steps!

Reviews.Title: “took one look and checked out”
Reviews.Author: bot37
Reviews.Content: i was bringing my elderly mother for a weekend to London, i booked this hotel we went in it looked nothing like the website, the man at reception was not nice at all we were told to take it or leave it,we went up to the room it was too small it looked like something from the dark ages big stain on the ceiling the carpet had not been hovered a light switch broken on the wall, toilet was dirty, 2 single bed crammed into room i checked out and stayed in a hotel down the road which was much better

Reviews.Title: “Do not stay here!!”
Reviews.Author: fm12
Reviews.Content: Myself and a colleague checked into this hotel for 3 nights on buisness. The hotel is terrible - it is in a very poor state of repair with broken tiles on the floor of both of our bathrooms and exposed electrical wires coming out of the switch in my room. The bath tap came of in my colleagues hand and my shower smelt very bad, My "double" room had barely enough space to walk around it and the cupboard door could not open fully as the room was so small. My colleagues window was right next to an external fire escape staircase so she could not leave her window open at night as it would have been very easy for an intruder to enter. Many of the fire escapes were partially bloked with rubbish or furniture and one did not close properly. The hairdryer fused straight away. The lift was scarely slow. Breakfast was terrible - only toast, cornflakes, orange juice, boiled eggs and cheese, despite the full english promised. The breakfast was not available until 7.30 and on one occasion there was no milk until 7.45, when the staff came back from the shop with it. Despite the fact that I was a customer who had been waiting for milk for my cereal AND I was queueing for it, a member of staff thought nothing of pushing in front of me and helping herself to a glass of milk to enjoy with her breakfast. There were always at least 2, if not 4, members of staff sat in the dining area having their breakfast at the same time as the guests. They did not wait for quests to get their food first, simply helped themselves without any regard to anyone else. The staff were all rude and unhelpful. I would strongly advise anyone thinking of staying here not to. It is not cheap enough to justify the stay. I have travelled in many countries and am used to quite poor hotel conditions but this was really not acceptible.

Reviews.Title: “Poor condition of room and hotel. Fancy pictures at internet are misleading”
Reviews.Author: Kaunisa
Reviews.Content: Never been in such a poor condition hotel. Window panels were in very poor condition. Toilet/ bathroom in very bad condition. Bed made our backs hurt (IÂ´m having some spinal issues and my wife was bregnant). Web page pictures are really misleading as well as mentioning of bar and nightclub. Can not recommend, not when price is at that level.

Reviews.Title: “Poor staff, poor rooms”
Reviews.Author: racedk
Reviews.Content: Tiny,worn,cold ugly rooms. No shower one morning. Staff wasn't present when needed roomkey. And we where the lucky ones. Our friends lived directly above the underground, and didn't get much sleep. Uncozy restaurant, with a boring, dull breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Fancy sleeping in a badly fitted kitchen?”
Reviews.Author: Giraffe3
Reviews.Content: No, me neither but that, unfortunately, is where you might end up if you book a stay in the Ascot hotel. When I arrived I was checked in and given a key to a room on the second floor only to find it had someone elses belongings inside. Returning to reception the guy behind the desk says "someone else in that one is there?" as if it's a fairly normal occurrence. The vacant room I was next given (which is out of the hotel, down the street and above a restaurant) feels more like a halfway house than a hotel. Unlocked door from the street into a scruffy hallway, room numbers scrawled onto the doors in pen, and a room best described as a badly fitted kitchen with a double bed in it. To be fair it had a nice, new looking ensuite bathroom but that really is the only positive. The worst thing about the room is the fact it contains a boiler right beside the bed which, at best, means you have zero chance of a good nights sleep as it is constantly noisy and at worst makes you feel rather unsafe. To top it all reception phoned the room after 10pm to say they needed to come in to check the boiler as it heated a room downstairs! Having stayed in many different hotels in Paddington across the past year I can say the management at this one seems by far the most shambolic and the only hotel I've felt unsafe in.

Reviews.Title: “Cheap hotel , but clean”
Reviews.Author: jenstjeld Posted by a Finn traveler
Reviews.Content: The staff looks like they wish they were another place. No intress in the customers. Need new painting , new tails in the bath , and a new breakfastroom. but... Clean sheets all days , clean towels and cleaning was ok....Could been worse.. If I want to stay in a 5 star hotell , I'll book that , but for a couple of nights for a cheap price in London???this is ok , close too Oxford street and other things..

Reviews.Title: “Highly recommended.........that you stay somewhere else!”
Reviews.Author: Mr_trip_UK
Reviews.Content: Ok the positive stuff first: Location: Really couldn't be better. Come straight out of Paddington station and you are there: Price: You really can't grumble at 35 Quid. Now the negative: Staff: Strangely disinterested service. At first I thought it was me, but then read these reviews and see that the staff are disinterested with all their guests.I'd booked online a couple of hours earlier but they didn't seem to have a record of my booking on a computer. Instead they just had a stack of paper they needed to rummage through first before they found my booking. Room: I was escorted back out of the hotel onto the street to get to the "Annex". The single door a bit down the road look like you were entering someone's flat! Immediately as you walked in there was a smell of gas. Reading these reviews where people talk about the strange smell i'm convinced that's it....and I wouldn't be at all surprised to read that this hotel had blown up one day in the future if they don't get that fixed! I climbed the mountain of stairs and entered my room with the flimsy lock. Facilities: TV on the wall had a missing remote control so was impossible to switch on. Shower didn't drain away properly and took 45mins to completely empty. Kettle and coffee there but the coffee somehow tasted of those blue blocks you'd put in a toilet....so that's what I did....tipped it down the toilet in disgust! Cleanliness: Bathroom still had rubbish from previous guest. Bed Linen & Towels were clean though. I didn't fancy the idea of breakfast in the place. Before booking this place I'd looked at a couple of other places but saw their website at the last minute and thought I'd found a real bargain. The website makes the place look very modern and trendy and at a very low price. Based on that I immediately booked it thinking I'd made a great decision! All I can say is that I think the website is very misleading and some of the images they show of cool dining rooms etc actually belong to a separate restaurant below the hotel! Summary: If you are really after the absolute lowest price for a place with a great location then go for this.....but if you value a bit of polite customer service, clean rooms where everything works and don't want to die in a gas explosion then I'd pay a bit more and look somewhere else!

Reviews.Title: “a disgrace it should be knocked down”
Reviews.Author: wynnea
Reviews.Content: this hotel is the worst ive stayed in for a start nothing like the pics on the web its smelly rundown, dirty, in bits. we had to change rooms as the room had half a kitchen in a box room with walls that were black from a leak,tiles broke,no hot water, smelly carpet,rude staff we booked out earlier than planned. the fire escapes where blocked on all floors by broken beds and mattresses. the bar in the basement you wouldn drink or eat in it!!!!! **********DO NOT STAY HERE IT SHOULD BE CLOSED DOWN BY ENVIRONMENTAL HEALTH***********!!!!!!!!!!! WOULD NOT RECOMMEND TO ANYONE

Reviews.Title: “do not stay here”
Reviews.Author: oscarGwent
Reviews.Content: First night put us in room two doors away in no.09a bed up against window to keep it shut .main frontdoor open 24/7.next night put in main hotel 10 floors up lift only go's up one floor.breakfast if you are lucky you will get a table but you must tell the staff it is there job to clean the table before you eat at it.As they told me to clean someone elses mess.people stood round eating there breakfast where they stood.It was a free for all,nothing like pictures on web site.Good job we was only there 3nights.very cold in room asked to put heating on but they did not. came home with cold.

Reviews.Title: “Could somebody please pull down this facility!”
Reviews.Author: skst1068
Reviews.Content: My worst experience ever. This is not a hotel - this is a crime! Dirt everywhere, bad smell, defective door locks, indifferent staff, no phone in the room as explained on their website, mould in the bathroom, minimum water pressure makes it difficult to take a shower, worn carpets with holes, terrible smell out of the tub plug hole. In the beds with the ancient saggy mattresses you have to expect to get seasick. When you check in they want to get paid in advance - once you have seen your room you know why. SERIOUS WARNING: Don't stay there!

Reviews.Title: “HORRIBLE”
Reviews.Author: motan
Reviews.Content: It's horrible. I do not recommend to any of my enemies to accomodate at Ascot Hyde Park in London. Is the most horrible hotel that I ever state: old furniture, broken and dirty carpet, bad smell everywhere. The restaurant is in a basement, in the small place , the furniture is jammed in the first world war: old furniture, with chairs and tablesbroken. Tables are covered with faces of plastic (vinyl) material. Do not ever never accommodated here - better sleep in Hyde Park which is close.

Reviews.Title: “The worst experience in 40 years of travel”
Reviews.Author: ABCoftravel_9
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel first for a one night stay and then for an additional stay of three nights the following week. The first night was passable but the kettle and hairdryer did not work. The bad part came the following week. Instead of the hotel I was offered a "basic room" in the annex because supposedly there was water damage in my room. This annex room is smaller than a jail cell. A bed a chair. That is it. No bedside table(no room) no mirror. no bath, shower toilet or sink. For that you have to climb up twenty wobbly steps. The lock is so flimsy anyone could open the door with a hairpin or crdit card. the building shakes and rumbles from the tube line under the street. I didn't have nightmares, because I couldn't sleep. Pay a bit more and don't ruin your vacation by staying in this "hotel" PS I also have pictures of broken bathroom tiles, chipped sink and rusty mirror I couldn't take a picture of the remote, there was non.

Reviews.Title: “like a tent in the desert”
Reviews.Author: APOLENARI
Reviews.Content: it's a shame to call this trash building hotel.the word dirty is a complement.we felt likr in a prisoners' camp in the sahara desert.don't even try to step inside.the prisoners will cheat you.run away as fast as you can.sad to say i'm trapped in this cage right now

Reviews.Title: “Do Not Stay Here!!!!! Its Terrible”
Reviews.Author: NorwayGuro
Reviews.Content: After winning some money at a tvshow, I descided to treat myself, my boyfriend, my litlesister and my litlebrother a trip to London!!! I booked this hotel before I came, because it look like a OK hotel on the webpage. WELL.... When I came, we had to pay for both rooms, and all three nights before we got to see the rooms. BAD MISTAKE. The rooms was in another building. So we had to go outside again and a few meters down the street, and then through another door. I started to get nervous. My brother (who works in the police) was very shocked over that we had to go out of the hotel, and in another door to get to our rooms.. It wasent very safe! The rooms was on the 5th floor, and there was no lift. The rooms was terrible. The bath was diry, the beds where dirty, we could'nt close one of the windows so we heard everything that was going on down at the street. We checket out again, one hour after we arrived. There was no chanse that we could get much sleep in that awfull hotel. The man in the reseption said that we couldn't get any money back (we had allready pre-paid for two rooms for three nights.. bad mistake) The man at the reseption was angry. So we left.... We booked two rooms at the Holiday Inn Mayfair, a beatyfull hotel.. But thats another story :o)

Reviews.Title: “do not pay in full online for this 'hotel'”
Reviews.Author: kayay
Reviews.Content: i paid in full online for this hotel and wish i hadnt. booked it because the pictures looked promising and there was a lift to every floor, the main selling point for me as i have arthritis. when we got there my daughter and i were shown to a separate building two doors away. the room we were given looked like staff or dss accomodation as i have never stayed in a hotel before that had one wall taken up with work top fitted cooker and washing machine!!. it was a small room the whole floor space taken up with a double bed. the shower looked clean but when i used it the shower filled up with water because the drain was blocked, with what, i tried not to think about it. my daughter chose not to shower. the inner door lock was very flimsy and the outer door was open and unattended until 1am. myself and my daughter had both felt safer on the streets. the drawer fronts fell off the one bedside cabinet at the slightest touch. the shower door was one of those cheap corrugated folding ones. when i told the guy at reception i had booked the hotel because of the promise of a lift he said there was nothing he could do about it. so my arthritic hips, knees and spine had to travel up and down five flights of stairs. the bed linnen however was clean although the towels had a strange vinegary smell. i cant speak for the main hotel as i only saw the reception area and we didnt have breakfast as we just wanted to get out of there as soon as possible. as with most of the reviewers on here the only good thing i can say about the ascot, which i understood to be the ascot hyde park, maybe changed to try and avoid the onslaught of bad reviews, is the location. had i only paid a deposit, i would not have stayed there.

Reviews.Title: “THIS IS A REALLY CRAPPY HOTEL - DO NOT GO THERE”
Reviews.Author: gangaSwitzerland
Reviews.Content: My family and I were at this hotel for a week in march 09 - i had booked a family room - the first room i was shown was a normal double room with 2 extra beds dumped in front of the wardrobe so that this could not be opened - I asked for another room and was offered one on the 5th floor which was not accessible by a lift - there was some more space at the expense of furniture as even the phone was on the floor as no table would fit between the beds - very bare room, with broken tiles in the bathroom which cracked when you walked on them, a handtowel rail which kept coming off the wall, tv remote not working..... on protesting i was told that this is what they have and as this was one of the very few hotels which still had some rooms left over the easter period, i had no choice but to take it - it is really a shame that the london tourist board should let this hotel operate as it definitely is a crappy one.

Reviews.Title: “The Special Offer price was very good value for money”
Reviews.Author: Quiglies
Reviews.Content: Excellent value, in a central location on bus and tube routes, with an acceptable level of service.

Reviews.Title: “Please avoid at All Cost”
Reviews.Author: SJ_Tourist
Reviews.Content: Due to an unrefundable booking through a travel agent we were compelled to stay 3 nights in one of their "new" 2 bedroom flats. Space prevents a full description of the horrors. Basic facilities were missing or broke down, the staff were generally indifferent, the bar/breakfast room was insanitary, one can hear and feel the arrival of trains at the nearby Tube Station etc etc. The website is completely misleading, it is best described as a low level backpackers hostel.

Reviews.Title: “Location, Location, Location”
Reviews.Author: jewl18
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Ascot for 2 nights in February and were extremely grateful it was only for 2 nights. As mentioned in previous reviews, there was no-one at the desk when we arrived. He was actually outside having a cigarette and had decided not to follow us in. This was a common theme. Either that or there would be a few members of staff at the desk who had just decided to ignore you. Our room was not ready but we were advised that they had a "luggage room" available if we wished to leave our bags - this turned out to be a cupboard in the dining room that anyone could have access to and was piled high with bags and suitcases. The hotel itself is pretty grim. As also previously mentioned there is a peculiar smell in the entire building that they have attempted to mask with multiple plug in air fresheners. The whole building is extremely run down - carpets are worn, dirty and torn, plug sockets and various wires hang from the walls, the walls have holes in them, the ceilings also have holes and are sagging with damp in places and the corridors are generally filled with bags of rubbish and excess pieces of furniture (fold- away beds etc). You can't help but pray that you don't need to escape from the building in a hurry. Our room was actually a decent size - a double and a single bed and had the obligatory plug in air freshener. It was as run down as the rest of the hotel and unlike other reviews had obviously not been cleaned before we went in. The lock on our door did not appear particularly trustworthy, the cups were filthy and the shower was a disgrace. In fact you would have thought that it was actually in the process of being renovated - half of the tiles appeared to have just been put on and the rest looked like they were about to fall off. The bed sheets appeared to have been changed but were still dusty. We also discovered that a chair in the corner of the room was actually the only thing holding the curtains up as well! That was quite amusing when we moved the chair and the whole thing fell down! The electrics were a bit odd - you had to press a combination of switches in order to turn the main light on and off and out of the 3 bulbs on the lamp only 1 of them actually worked. The roof had patches of damp, particularly above the lights and there was a distinct rustling that I wouldn't have been surprised to discover was rats. You could hear the underground regularly but that wasn't actually too much of a problem and you have to expect some noise in central london. We didn't hear much noise from other rooms although the hotel in general appeared pretty quiet whilst we were there so that may differ when it's busy. Reading previous reviews, it also appears that we may have been placed in the staff bedroom (210), so perhaps we were lucky that we weren't actually near the staff on our stay. Although we were offerred a continental breakfast we didn't actually try it - the fact that the cups in our room weren't clean was enough to put us off attempting to eat there. There was a hairdryer that worked in our room and we had no problems with the TV. The only good thing about this hotel was the location. It is a five minute walk from Paddington station and so has easy access to Heathrow. It's also a 5-10 minute walk from Kensington Gardens and Hyde Park. One staff member was relatively helpful when we enquired about transport , even booking a taxi for us, although this appeared to be a friend of his and we don't know London well enough to know whether he took advantage, he did take a lot of side roads and dropped us off a good bit from our destination although admittedly there were a fair bit of roadworks. All in all, we won't be returning to this hotel any time soon. It's in a great location and served ok simply as somewhere to lie down at night but there's no way we would have stayed there for longer than 2 nights.

Reviews.Title: “Do not Stay there...”
Reviews.Author: SofiaGeorgia
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel for a week in January. The only good thing I can say about this hotel is the location. It is located next to Paddington Station (easy access to any place in London). The breakfast was poor, everyday the same and it was hard to find a free table to sit. The tiny room looked very old although it was cleaned everyday. There was a specific bad smell. It was the worst hotel experience for me. If you are looking for a budget trip and your main request is the location you can try this hotel, but in any other case you will be dissapointed!

Reviews.Title: “worst hotel ever”
Reviews.Author: arind
Reviews.Content: Please avoid this hotel for any reason. It might be a cheap hotel but it is filthy. I am really wondering what has been recently renovated in this hotel as it is mentioned in many websites! Maybe the elevator? And you can hear the tube crossing under the hotel every few minutes. Do not visit this hotel!!!

Reviews.Title: “Glad it was just a night!”
Reviews.Author: gully867
Reviews.Content: Stayed here after traveling back from America to get some rest before an onward train journey the following morning. Location is good as it is right next to Paddington Station. However I'm glad my stay was just a night! Stayed in a room with two singles, the room was cramped, bed was small and I could feel the springs. Did not get a great night sleep and I could hear the elevator all night. Like other reviews have mentioned: mould around the window and bottom of walls, mould in bathroom, etc. Hotel had free Wi-Fi but it didn't work. From what the room was like I didn't bother with the free breakfast. I have had a better night sleep in a Hostels bed! For people staying looking at staying here while on holiday: Look else where, don't get drawn in by the cheap price tag!

Reviews.Title: “Hated this hotel”
Reviews.Author: belfastshelly
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a christmas break with the family. It is the Hotel from Hell. The staff slept in room 210 and didnt keep quiet until well after 3.00am.. we were in room 209 - therefore we got no sleep. Thankfully we were only there 2 nights (I couldnt have stayed any longer). My hands were sore from banging the wall so much to get them to shut up but all for nothing, they merely ignored my pleas to get some sleep!!! The rooms were small and dark & very smelly. (plug in air freshners everywhere to try and mask it) carpet ripped in several places. Stairs dangerous and there was definitely staff smoking in the hotel. It is very run down. Sink had no water pressure or plug so it didnt matter much about the water pressure as you couldnt use the sink anyway. Had to take a shower with dirty shower curtain and low pressure shower. Breakfast was a real treat. Do it yourself toast and choice of cold boiled egg and ham. Staff not overly pleasant. I BEG YOU DONT STAY HERE... You will hate it... I couldnt believe how quickly people wanted to get out of there. We were almost stampeded in the rush of eager tourist escaping on the dot of 9.00 am without even enjoying their delightful breakfast, checkout isnt until 11.00am (Though we also left at 9.00am LOL.... Enough is Enough sometimes.

Reviews.Title: “Worst room in Western Europe!!!”
Reviews.Author: matkaman
Reviews.Content: DO NOT GO THERE! THESE REVIEWS ARE TRUE! PAY 10 MORE BUCKS AND GO SOMEWHERE ELSE! I can not believe that there is Hotels like this in Western Europe. I have travelled in Russia, South America, Asia etc..Actually the room in Ascot Hotel was worst and dirtiest I have ever seen in any hotel. I did read this and saw some bad pictures of the rooms and before I booked this hotel online I knew that it was not luxury, average or bad hotel. But it was worst than bad. I donÂ´t know what is the best english word to describe it. Maybe horrible, disgusting, sick, growse, and dangerous together. There was nobody in the front desk when I walked in to the hotel. Few people walked in and just picked up their keys behind the desk. I waited there about 20minutes until the clerk walked in like nothing had happened and gave me the key. I took the elevator to the second floor and started to look for room 105. There was one different looking door in the hallway and it did say: ROOM 105 THIS WAY I opened the door and saw the stairs down. There was no light switch and the hallway was totally dark. I walked the stairs down and looked around bit. Stairs went one floor further where was all kind of construction equipment and no door to open to exit. Seemed pretty dangerous incase of fire. Because only way to exit the room was to walk to the second floor. Then I opened the door and saw the disqusting room. It was about size of 1,5meters x 2,5 meters. Everything was in the same room: toilet, shower, bed, desk and travel heater (one of those that you just plug in the wall) There was about 3-4 centimeter gap below the door and the lock was not safe. Two huge wholes in the wall. About 15-25centimeters wide and filled up with towels!!! I AM SERIOUS!!! Used toilet paper next to the sink and amazingly cold. After I moved the bed I saw the condom on the floor. Then I gave up... And I am not picky. I have stayed in pretty bad rooms, slept in the airport etc. I went to talk to the clerk and was as polite as possible. I talked with him about 3 x 30minutes (went back to my room because I thought I will survive and then back when I realized I can not stay here. Finally after long conversations I got new room. Two persons room costed about 26UK more. He said that there was no more one bedroom rooms. But I saw later on when some guy came in and got one bed room. SO I finally stayed there in the other room. It was bad room. But like heaven to the other room. Only minus was that mattres was not clean and there was no porn magazine under the bed. This did not bother me because I was so happy that I got out from the other room. Next day breakfest was ok. Only minus was that you had to eat it in the bar made to the basement. I do not mind about that. But some older people may not like to eat breakfest next to flashing slot machine. BAD: -Very cold room. Air blows in to the room from below of the door and from the cracks next to the window. -Only one plug-in in the room! If you want to use your electronics you have to plug out the heater. -Very Dirty mattres. Founded condom on the floor and used toilet paper next to sink. -Dusty bed. I could not sleep under the sheets. They were so dirty and dusty. Also clerk checked the room and said it was clean!!!:) -Dangerous and scary. Clerk does not spend most of the time in the front desk. -Bad service in the front desk. When you ask something politely the answer is: sorry, where are cheap hotel my friend. -Numerous other things.... GOOD: -Breakfest (Toast, Egs, Salamai, Serials) -Toilet did work -Shower had warm water -Two clean towels in the room -Close to the subway and bus stops

Reviews.Title: “Worst Hotel Ever”
Reviews.Author: MWPowers
Reviews.Content: I rue the day I ever heard of the Ascot Hyde Park Hotel. It is a filthy, disgusting hole, and not fit for human habitation. On my recent trip to the UK, I had the misfortune of booking a reservation in this pit; not knowing how horrible it actually was. After seeing the room, and the hotel (I us this word very loosely), I immediately went elsewhere. Yet because of their 72 hour cancellation policy, I was still charged for one night's stay. Frankly, I had rather been charged for an entire week than stay in that hell hole! Do not believe the lies that this place is anything but an open sewer waiting for you to toss in your money.

Reviews.Title: “Don't do it”
Reviews.Author: Travel_on_Occasion
Reviews.Content: Well, let me start by saying terrible is not exactly appropriate but is the best fit given the choices. However, it was pretty bad. As one other reviewer wrote, the carpet is in need of replacement (all over the hotel in my opinion). The room we had was in need of an overall update as well. However, everything worked. The rooms and common areas around the hotel were very small and/or narrow (not a surprise). However, the hotel had additional beds stored in the hallway! I shudder to think what would have happened had there been an emergency and the guests had to leave quickly. I also noticed on the website that it says its lift goes to all floors. Not correct. We were on the 5th floor. The lift only went to the 4th floor. Staff was okay and breakfast was sufficient. Note: no air conditioning (which wasn't surprising) but no fan available. If I hadn't gone to American Express to specifically avoid this type of situation perhaps I wouldn't be writing. But we did and were told they don't deal with anything less than 3 stars. This hotel is listed as 2 stars. Really?

Reviews.Title: “Well....”
Reviews.Author: BAM9984
Reviews.Content: I literally knew nothing about London when I booked this hotel and AFTER I booked it I read some reviews (stupid on my part). So right off the bat I was a little nervous. Positives: Great location if you need to use the train to Heathrow or are planning on using the tube. It is literally a minute walk to either (Paddington Station). It is also a really quiet neighborhood as it is mostly residential. The hotel is about 5 minutes walk to Hyde Park. I thought the staff was quite helpful and nice. We booked a double but ended up with a triple (one queen and one single) and payed the double rate. Free breakfast, which wasn't amazing but it definitely saved us some mula. London is expensive! There is an internet place a few doors down. Negatives: Lets face it, its an old moldy hotel. It smells damp. The shower curtain had mold on it. Our hair dryer and tv didnt work but the front desk guy fixed the tv and gave us a different dryer. The beds aren't terribly comfortable (I am small and could feel the springs). The elevator doesnt go to the 5th floor (only the 4th) and if you are as lucky as we were, you can hear the elevator shaft working away ALL NIGHT. Room was tiny but in my experience that is standard for Europe. My advice to you: If you are just using your hotel as a place to sleep/shower this place is fine. But if you want to be in the thick of the busy city and plan on hanging out in your room at all (why would you, you are in LONDON!) this is not the place. There is however a gorgeous Hilton across the street.

Reviews.Title: “Hated every second”
Reviews.Author: Ken27
Reviews.Content: This was the worst hotel We have ever stayed in. Do yourselves a favour and upgrade a bit. What a dump. If this was the last hotel in London I'd rather sleep in the gutter.

Reviews.Title: “If I Could Turn Back Time...”
Reviews.Author: ashdin
Reviews.Content: This was the absolute worst and most atrocious hotel that I have ever stayed in. It was literally frightening. I booked a â€œfamily roomâ€� package, which consisted of two rooms on the same floor in close proximity. I did this because I was told by hotels.com that it was forbidden to have more than two people per room for security reasons. Upon arriving at the hotel, I discovered that I was given one room that was supposed to house four people (a â€œquad roomâ€�). The room was absolutely horrifying: no lock on the door, dirty soaps stacked for new use (I found a hair on one of them), no toilet paper holder, light switches that didnâ€™t work, a wall heater that was precariously dangling at a 45 degree angle until it finally fell off, 4 gaping holes in the wall, a dirty shower, dysfunctional toilet, dirty windows, cracked floor tiles, and a phone with no dial tone. We called hotels.com immediately, and were promised a new â€œquad room,â€� despite our original reservation for a â€œfamily room.â€� The fact that hotels.com called down to the front desk for us, but refused to acknowledge the fact that we received one room instead of two, was the most infuriating part of our check-in process. I was on hold for at least 15 minutes; I could have stayed in the Savoy Hotel for the price of my useless phone call. The new room that we were given looked like a low-end dorm room: 4 twin beds in a line under a chipped and peeling faux-wood grade headboard, broken bathroom tiles, no door handle on the entry door, an uncloseable window, no toilet paper holder, dysfunctional toilet and sink, no light source, where else can I take this! Beware, o potential client, room 503 may have a view of chimneys and TV antennas with a partial image of the London Eye in the distance, but that moleskin door handle came from yours truly! Itâ€™s probably still up there for the next customer, but if not, grab the room numbers with your fingernails to help close the door when leaving. Donâ€™t even get me started on the stairs â€“ they were narrow, uneven, lumpy, cramped. If there were a fire, you would end up at the bottom of one of the many stairwells with a broken ankle. Out of the kindness of the hotels heart (haha), breakfast was provided in the basement (Steven King, what a book you could write on this place!) One of my fellow travelers had to leave the basement because of its low-lingering clouds of burnt toast, loud ethnic music, and dim lighting â€“ she had a panic attack, the first one out of a twenty-day vacation. The breakfast served was sliced white bread, a toaster, rancid lunchmeats, and coffee or tea. The only thing we were willing to stomach was the coffee. On our last morning at the hotel (thank god it was only three nights), we accidentally woke up a sleeping patron on the fifth floor, who was fast asleep on the dirty carpet of the hallway. Before you blame this experience on us six â€œpamperedâ€� women who donâ€™t know how to book a hotel, two other groups/guests were thrown into the same predicament: they booked a â€œfamily roomâ€� and were expecting two rooms, but were instead greeted with a smelly and dirty quad room, as were we. One of the groups was a Chemistry teacher and his three students that were addressing Parliament; another was a family from Sweden. All of the guests in this hotel were first-time clients there, and swore that they would never come back. Two of my fellow travelers in a different room said that their door supposedly locked but would pull open occasionally; for safety, they put their suitcases in front of it just in case. Every time somebody opened a door across the hall or in another part of the fifth floor, it sounded like someone was rattling the keys in your door, trying to get in. To be honest, the Ascot Hyde Park Hotel would be great for Halloween fright night for a bunch of drugged-out teenagers. The hotel looks more like the lowest-grade youth hostel one could find, but with an astronomical price tag. I wouldnâ€™t stay here even if I was paid, and would never wish these circumstances on a most despised enemy. Hotels.com lied to us when we booked the hotel, telling us that we would receive two rooms. Their customer assistance personnel felt that they were assisting by getting us yet another quad room, but failed to acknowledge that we werenâ€™t supposed to have that style of room in the first place. Beware of the photo on the website â€“ it is an image of the faÃ§ade of the building adjacent to the hotel. The only part of the photo that is the hotel is the small awning that appears in the lower right hand corner, that reads â€œAscot.â€� What you are seeing is a view of a restaurant next to the hotel. Please, do yourself a favor, and never stay in this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Do Not Enter!!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: hhunt2
Reviews.Content: never again!!!! the worst hotel on the planet. the ceiling came down on top of my husband, had to go up the street for your breakfast. was the most dirty smelly place ever. it needs pulled down please never stay here please this is not a joke.

Reviews.Title: “Worst place on earth!!!!!!!! would have rather slept rough!!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: gizzyLondon
Reviews.Content: This was truly the worst hotel i have EVER witnessed, DO NOT GO THERE!!! the carpet was filthy, the skirting boards were rotten, the bedding looked like a rug, the bed was uncomfortable, the bathroom was slanting and honestly did not have a single tile which was not cracked or dirty. we bought our own cleaning products into the hotel after discovering that there were no other rooms available elsewhere- we checked the internet 5 minutes after being in the room! the people working at the desk were also unhelpful, informing us that we could not check in until 1.30pm, although their website states 1pm check in. the radiator in our room was hanging off the wall, and the stairs throughout the hotel felt as though they were caving in! we paid Â£72 a night to stay there, but they were charging Â£120 on site! how they can charge anything is beyond me, they should pay the people who have to endure the stay! Be warned, do not go to this place!!!!!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Good value for money”
Reviews.Author: GerardHvB
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel for two nights in April 2008. Having read the reviews on Tripadvisor I feared the worst. However, the hotels was much better than one would expect based on the reviews posted here. Given the fact that you are in London, the low rates (I payed about 50 pounds per night for a single room) and the excellent location, this is a very good choice. Contrary to the experiences of other reviewers, I did have (very) hot water, my room was rather small but fairly clean and the staff was friendly and helpful. They had a locked luggage room and breakfast was simple indeed, but ok. In my opinion: good value for money, I would certainly recommend this hotel for a stay during a city trip if do not need a lot of luxury.

Reviews.Title: “you couldn't male this up...horrible!”
Reviews.Author: Sandra4u
Reviews.Content: Worst experience ever. I moved to England from Canada and booked an amazing trip for my sister to come and visit. One of our stops was London.. we booked this hotel after HOURS of flights/trains. We got in at 10pm and were told they could not find our reservation! So, cheeky me, I pulled out a copy of it. Then the VERY UNHELPFUL man at the reception desk says they are fully booked and cannot give me a room but will put me in his sister hotel and that a cab will take us there and everything would be explained to us. We were literally pushed out of the hotel in the pouring rain and put in a cab. The cab had no idea what was going on and nothing was explained.... after quite some time we were given the name/location as to where to go. They didnt even play for the cab! And the sister hotel had no idea. PLEASE learn from my experience and don't stay here... it's cheap... and it is for a reason!

Reviews.Title: “attention!”
Reviews.Author: GGdesk
Reviews.Content: I was at The Ascot - Ascot hyde Park in London in Craven Road (and I'm sure that when i booked on line my journay the name was ASCOT HYDE PARK but now on tripadvisor.com there isn't anymore??? It means somethinhg???)in the middle of january 2008 for few days. The furnishing of the room was very very OLD STYLE.. the rooms are very very narrow and it was impossible to move. In the bathroom the ceiling and the wall was umid and come down.After a complain they gave us a just a bit better room... the same of the first one but without the ceiling that come down...in compensation the microscopic washbasin had two separate taps so you can decide or to burn otherwise to freeze your hands.. fortunately there isn't a bidet ;) Of positive there is that the hotel it's just a 3minutes walk from the stop of Paddington Tube.

Reviews.Title: “Worst hotel I have ever stayed at”
Reviews.Author: faithc
Reviews.Content: This is, by far, the worst hotel I have ever stayed at, and I have travelled quite a bit. Wallpaper peeling, smelly, depressing, non-working elevator, grungy carpets, unsuitable bathroom...the list could go on and on. The only really pleasant thing about the place was the staff at the reception.

Reviews.Title: “cramped family”
Reviews.Author: rucsac2go
Reviews.Content: tatty facilities. Lift not working. Room not ready on arrival.Insufficient bedding. Missing plugs in bathroom. Toilet not flushing and on and on!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Bad hotel...beware”
Reviews.Author: AKaBoston
Reviews.Content: Really bad hotel, that has only one thing going for it...location right next to Paddington Station in Central London. Hotel rooms are really shabby. Our room had a dresser with a missing drawer. The curtain on the big full length window was thin and torn, so that it wouldnt even close fully. The beds are really bad, and i think there are bed bugs in it too. The room didnt have airconditioning, and didnt have a fan either. We stayed there on the 22nd of Sep, and it was hot outside..we had to leave the big window open, which meant that it was very noisy...the hotel is on a busy street...there was loud traffic and people talking outside on the street, until 1am. The underground, runs under the hotel and every few minutes you can feel the rumble of the trains as they pass below you. Luckily the trains stop between 2am-5am, i think. The hotel didnt even bother putting new soap in the bathroom..we had used soap in the washbin and shower! Luckily for us, there were 4 small shampoo packets, which we used as soap! The toilet tank takes a really long time to fill up too....so if there are two of you, you gotta wait! The staff at reception isnt friendly at all. Use this hotel as a last resort, really. There are plenty of hotels right next to it, all around Paddington station, so choose wisely.

Reviews.Title: “Do Not Stay Here”
Reviews.Author: Sue42
Reviews.Content: My brother booked this hotel months ago as we (there were eight members of my family) had to be sure that we had somewhere to stay the night before the London Marathon. When we arrived in the morning our first impressions were not good, very small and shabby, painted over peeling wallpaper, a strong musty smell which was almost overpowered by the smell of new paint. However, we were only staying for one night, it was just somewhere to sleep, it was relatively cheap so what did we expect! We told the receptionist who we were and she allowed us to leave our bags and off we went for the day. After a lovely day we went back to the hotel and it was then that things started to go wrong. The receptionist, the same one from earlier, explained that there was no hot water on the fourth floor and that people had been checking out all day and that she had arranged for us to stay in 2 family rooms in a hotel nearby for no extra charge! I told her this was unacceptable and that we could put up with not having hot water. She then said that the plumbers would need to be in and out of our rooms all night to fix the boilers which made no sense at all! We asked to see the rooms for ourselves to make up our minds to which she replied that the manager had told her not to show anyone the rooms. Obviously by this time we were getting very suspicious and on asking someone from the fourth floor discovered that there was nothing wrong with the hot water. She then told us it was only certain rooms, namely the four that we had booked, what a coincidence!! Then, as if by magic the "plumber" walked by, although he had been the painter when we saw him at work in the morning! We asked to see the manager and even though she told us that he had been there obviously he had somehow managed to sneak passed her! Eventually after several attempts she got through to him on the phone. He was extremely rude and unhelpful and told us that we would just have to put up with it, there would be no refund and there was nothing he could do. To be honest at this point we felt that he was right, there was nothing else to do but to put up with it and go to the other hotel, even though we knew that a hotel with rooms available on the Saturday night before the Marathon was going to be even worse that this one. How right we were! We were taken to the other hotel by another young woman, obviously the receptionist had had enough of us by this time and chickened out, actually I think she was very wise not to take us! When we arrived we were taken to the basement and were shown our room, yes one room with a double bed and a bunk bed, for eight of us!! The new receptionist told us she'd only been asked for one room. After much shouting and running around they emptied someones things out of another room and allowed us to have that one. At least it had a double and two singles. She later told us that the Ascot Hotel had double booked our rooms and she was often called upon to help them out and that the rooms we were in were only meant for workers and not usually let out! By this time we didn't really care, we just wanted somewhere to sleep and to forget the whole thing, unfortunately being in the basement at the front of the hotel where the windows did not shut properly and in a street where there were signs warning curb crawlers they would be prosecuted you can imagine that there was little sleep to be had! So much for my marathon preparation! So in summary, read the bad reviews on this hotel, believe them and never stay there!

Reviews.Title: “If you llike hot water, stay somewhere else”
Reviews.Author: LMR0605
Reviews.Content: We searched for budget hotels in this area because we had stayed in the area before. We're pretty active, so only planned on being in the room to sleep and clean up. Good points: 1)It was clean. 2) The front desk staff was very nice. 3) We had our own bathroom. 4) Great location next to Paddington Station and tube. Bad points: 1)We had twin beds that the staff kept pulling apart. 2) I had one hot shower in the 4 nights we stayed there. We tried at 7am, 4pm, 12am, and 3am but to no avail. We even had to sit down to shower because the handheld shower nozzle had nothing to hang it from on the wall. The desk staff was "working on it". 3) It was very noisy. Bunch of foreign kids running up and down the stairs. You could hear drunk folks leaving the bar on the corner very late at night. 4) No air conditioning and very little heat from the radiator. 5) Very small, hardly any room for our suitcase. 6) 3 tv stations, and the tv was tiny and literally on the ceiling. Very hard to watch the news or weather. 7) You get one towel a day. No washcloths. 8) Continental breakfast okay, but all carbs. 9) The Hilton is right across the street and connects to the Train Station. Pay the extra money and stay there, because you'll be looking at it wistfully the entire time you're here.

Reviews.Title: “Do not stay here. It is BAD!!!”
Reviews.Author: bbb-7
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel for a 5 day stay. When we checked up on the address two days before we were due to arrive we noticed all the negative reviews for this hotel. I phoned them up and they ensured me that none of them were true and they had totally renoveted the hotel. There were no ladders in corridors etc, everything was in order. We arrived at the hotel at 1745 on a Friday evening and asked to see the room. It was then that our fears were realised. On they way upstairs we passed a portable electricheater in the foyer with a leg missingand all lopsided, loose wires in the stairway and loose carpet on the stairs. We got to the room, via a dark corridor as there were no bulbs in the lights after passing ladders and fire doors wedged open. The door was very flimsy with gaps around it and a lock that did not work properly. The room was painted recently but everything was still at least 20 years old including the bed, wooden toilet seat, hair dryer that did not work. The route to the fire escape had no lights, ceiling and had wires hanging down. I reported back to the reception desk and advised that I did not wish to stay there as we did not feel safe. They said everything was new etc... We decided not to stay so looked for another hotel. We ended up at IBIS, also a 3 star hotel but almost new, similar price and a restaurant. So much better After talking to the manager the next day he dismissed my observations and charged me for the first nights accommodation as he said he was in business to make money.

Reviews.Title: “DonÂ´t stay here!!”
Reviews.Author: Nisse52
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 3 nights and we are never coming back!!! 3 light-bulbs were out. The shower hose was mended with tape so most of the water leaked out there. The radiator was hot and sounded like an entire rhythm-orchestra in the middle of the night. You could flush the toilet once in the morning and then again in the evening due to bad water pressure. We wrote a note with our complaints and presented it to the man in the reception and he promised to fix it. But nothing happened!

HotelInfo.Name: The Ascot Hotel
HotelInfo.Address: 11 Craven Road, London W2 5BP, England
